alert.note: Alert for Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 2:41PM CDT until August 28 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parish, Terrebonne. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways across the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 241 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen from recent storms. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Houma and Bayou Cane. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
